“Welcome to London” – Terms Agreed, Arsenal target set to complete £26m move

Arsenal have been dealt a serious blow in the pursuit of Portuguese international and Barcelona’s owned Everton midfielder André Gomes.

According to reports reaching this morning, the Gunners London bitter rivals Tottenham Hotspur has reported agreed personal terms with the La Liga giants to sign Gomes.

Gomes is entering the final stage of his season-long loan spell at Everton, where the Portuguese Euro2016 winner has impressed in his 26 Premier League appearances, netting one goal and one assist in the run.

However, according to Spanish outlet SPORT, the Gomes will not be staying at Goodison Park next term with Spurs close to snapping up the player.

Footy Extras

Arsenal boss wants to sign winger for club as Gunners line up move for Brazilian ace
Published by Footy Extras on May 11, 2019

Arsenal are reportedly in the race to lure Brazilian attacker Antony away from Sao Paolo this summer transfer window.

The Gunners are said to be desperate to land a winger at the end of the campaign as Unai Emery plan to add pace and width to his side.

According to Yahoo, the North London giants are one of a host of clubs planning to nab Antony, with the star available for £21 million.

Ajax, AS Monaco, PSV Eindhoven and Lyon are all understood to be vying for the 19-year-old star, along with the Gunners.

They state that Antony’s representative Junior Pedroso has flown to the continent to hold a series of meeting with possible suitors.
